alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Spencer; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 3:11PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Warrick, northeastern Spencer, southeastern Gibson and southeastern Pike Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 211 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lynnville, or 9 miles south of Oakland City, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Folsomville and Dale. This includes Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 36 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for southwestern Indiana.
